column4: It is an alternative desktop environment (smaller, works on older computers)
Using aptitude will make sure you don't get loads of unneeded packages installed after you remove something (KDE depends on lots of things that GNOME doesn't use)
Is there one that doesn't have WYSIWYG in it?
Can I install Bluefish by sudo apt-get install bluefish
That is GUI, but not WYSIWYG
Bluefish looks like a nice editor
I hate coding html. I like nvu :)
I really don't like NVU's way of writing in the code, I like HTML.
HTML is easier for me rather than figuring out a WYSIWYG program
:) (nvu is basically the same as Mozilla Composer, but in GTK, so I know it's layout anyway)
